items.summary: After calling time on her decorated 15-year career, a spell in media commentary looks inevitable for Australian cricket star Alyssa Healy.

items.title: Taylah Preston makes Hobart International quarterfinals after upset win over Rebecca Sramkova
items.summary: The 20-year-old world number 204, who also has a wildcard at the upcoming Australian Open, won the match against the world number 72 6-4, 6-1.

items.title: US needs Greenland for purpose of national security, says Trump ahead of talks
items.summary: Greenlandic and Danish foreign ministers will meet US Vice-President JD Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio in Washington after the US renews threats to take control of the Arctic island.

items.title: 'Significant' theft of toxic poppies could cause death, Tasmanian authorities warn
items.summary: The theft of a "significant quantity" of medicinal-grade poppies could result in a "life-threatening" situation if they are ingested in pursuit of a high, Tasmanian authorities warn.

items.title: Peak Jewish group urges Labor to 'get rid' of hate exemption for religious texts
items.summary: Representatives of the Jewish community and Australian National Imams Council front a snap parliamentary hearing called to probe Labor's legislative response to the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: New project at old Port Augusta power station site to create 150 jobs and 'green cement'
items.summary: About 150 jobs will be created by a new "green cement" project at a power station site which has sat vacant for nearly a decade, the SA government says.

items.title: China reports $US1.2 trillion trade surplus in 2025 despite Trump trade war
items.summary: A shift away from the United States toward South-East Asia, Africa and Latin America has helped Chinese exports remain strong.

items.title: Prayer hall linked to notorious preacher Wisam Haddad to close permanently
items.summary: A controversial prayer hall in south-west Sydney linked to notorious Islamic preacher Wisam Haddad has announced it will permanently close.

items.title: Farmers hurt by Victorian fires to receive $50m state and federal support package
items.summary: The Allan government says it will provide grants and loans to support farmers who have lost homes, livestock, infrastructure and feed in the Victorian fires.

items.title: Pilbara home to five animal species most impacted by habitat loss, report finds
items.summary: The Australian Conservation Foundation says tens of thousands of hectares of land were approved for clearing last year, double that of 2024, putting already endangered species at further risk.

items.title: Socceroos midfielder Jackson Irvine ruled out 'until further notice' with recurrence of foot injury
items.summary: Socceroos midfielder Jackson Irvine is facing an extended stint on the sidelines heading into this year's World Cup.

items.title: These were the most-borrowed books from Brisbane libraries in 2025
items.summary: New data has revealed there were 5.9 million physical items — including books, CDs and DVDs — checked out of Brisbane libraries in 2025.

items.title: Our changing climate in 2025 in pictures and graphs as Australia kicks off year with extreme heat, fires
items.summary: Extreme heat, droughts, storms and deadly floods challenged resilience not only in Australia, but across the globe.

items.title: Publishers, bookstores pull Craig Silvey's work in response to child exploitation material charges
items.summary: The fallout of the high-profile child exploitation material allegations against Craig Silvey starts to ripple through the literary community, as the renowned author faces charges of possessing and distributing illicit material.

items.title: Australian Open qualifying: Bernard Tomic easily beaten by Arthur Fery, Olivia Gadecki knocked out
items.summary: Bernard Tomic was brushed past by Britain's Arthur Fery in their second round match, while Olivia Gadecki was beaten by Sloane Stephens.

items.title: White whale spotted off Crescent Head coast in 'unusual' summer sighting
items.summary: Researchers are asking for the public's help to learn more about the health of the albino whale, which was seen from Crescent Head on the Mid North Coast.

items.title: White whale spotted off "New South Whales" Mid North Coast
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: There is now a strong likelihood Donald Trump will order his military option of choice on Iran
items.summary: The Iranian regime has done exactly what Donald Trump warned against. Despite the information blackout, it is clear hundreds, if not thousands, of protesters have died and the US president is now likely to order a response, writes John Lyons.

items.title: Thanasi Kokkinakis withdraws from Adelaide International after injury setback
items.summary: Adelaide native Thanasi Kokkinakis withdraws from his home tournament on the eve of the Australian Open after suffering another injury setback in his opening-round win.

items.title: K-pop supergroup BTS announce Australian tour dates after military service
items.summary: The K-pop supergroup announce their first Australian tour dates since being discharged from the South Korean military.

items.title: Carranballac Cricket Club reduced to ashes after fire in western Victorian community of Streatham
items.summary: Leigh Graham lost his home and his "second home" — his local cricket club's rooms — in the fires that moved through the western Victorian community of Streatham. He still turned up to play two days later.

items.title: Randa Abdel-Fattah says lawyers have threatened defamation proceedings against Peter Malinauskas
items.summary: Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah says her lawyers have threatened defamation proceedings against South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas following his public commentary about her scheduled appearance at Adelaide Writers' Week.

items.title: Proposed changes to Queensland local government law a 'retrograde step', association warns
items.summary: The legislation, introduced by the government late last year, would automatically remove a mayor or councillor from office if they run for state parliament.

items.title: ASX flat, Trump savages 'jerk' Powell and Iran has oil traders betting on global chaos — as it happened
items.summary: The Australian share market flattens after a Wall Street retreat from record highs while global central bank chiefs, including RBA governor Michele Bullock, issue a joint statement backing US Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell, who is under criminal investigation.

items.title: Delcy Rodríguez balances Trump's demands amid military-backed coalition
items.summary: Venezuela is in the hands of both Donald Trump and a regime loyal to its ousted leader. The country's future, including the well-being of its people, is likely to depend on how well Delcy Rodríguez can walk a tightrope between Washington's demands and her coalition's hardliners.

items.title: Simple ways to reduce your exposure to microplastics around the home
items.summary: Researchers say there are some simple ways to help minimise our exposure to the microplastics and nanoplastics in our homes.

items.title: Feral goat costs Cobar business thousands
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Kingaroy Vinnies volunteer adopts chihuahua dumped in donation crate
items.summary: The chihuahua-cross was rescued by Vinnies volunteers who named the puppy "Vinnie". The charity says it is rare but unfortunately not unheard of for live animals to be donated.

items.title: Neurosurgeon Richard Laherty among five charged in Queensland crime and corruption investigation
items.summary: The ABC can reveal a neurosurgeon specialising in spinal surgery is among five people facing serious charges over a Queensland scheme allegedly involving kickbacks for medical devices.

items.title: Feral goat costs Cobar business thousands
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Goat's headbutt frenzy causes thousands of dollars in damage to Cobar business
items.summary: After finding his shopfront smashed, Shane Martin checked his CCTV to find that a feral goat was the culprit.

items.title: When does the Australian Open 2026 start and who are the favourites to win?
items.summary: With the 2026 Australian Open just around the corner here's everything you need to know about the tournament.

items.title: A tearful premier and 'Moscow on the Torrens': How to lose a writers' week in six days
items.summary: The removal and subsequent handling of Randa Abdel-Fattah's rescinded invitation to Adelaide Writers' Week led to the event's cancellation, with more than 180 authors pulling out and its own director issuing a pointed and very public resignation. Where does the festival go from here?

items.title: Future of Bondi Beach terror attack site up for debate as replacement flagged
items.summary: The Bondi Beach footbridge that some locals want removed following last month's terror attack was already going to need replacement for structural reasons.

items.title: Racism targeting migrant truck drivers rampant amid regulatory gaps
items.summary: Some Indian truck drivers have copped so much racist abuse they have stopped using their CB radios.

items.title: Russia's nuclear-capable hypersonic Oreshnik missile a new NATO dilemma
items.summary: Analysts say Russia's new Oreshnik hypersonic missile will continues to pose challenges for NATO after Moscow used the weapon for a second time in Ukraine.

items.title: Rare verified footage of Iran's protests posted online shows how the movement started and how it is growing
items.summary: The first embers of the Iranian protests started in a mobile phone market, spreading to every corner of the country as the Revolutionary Guard struggled to regain control.

items.title: Documents reveal tensions over Kunanyi/Mt Wellington access plans debate
items.summary: Loved by bushwalkers and tourists, a sacred Aboriginal site, and with weather conditions that can quickly deteriorate, Hobart's Kunanyi/Mount Wellington is a challenge to manage — and a government review of how that is done is being met with concerns.

items.title: Victoria's bushfires more than five times the size of Singapore
items.summary: Victoria's bushfires have now burnt across 404,000 hectares, or a total area more than five times the size of Singapore.

items.title: Prosecutors seek death penalty for Yoon Suk Yeol in South Korea after martial law call
items.summary: Yoon Suk Yeol faces several criminal charges related to his call to impose martial law and other criminal cases related to his time in office.

items.title: Clintons refuse to testify for US House Epstein investigation
items.summary: Republicans in the US House say they could commence contempt of Congress proceedings against the former president and former Democratic presidential nominee.

items.title: Around 2,500 reportedly killed in protests as Donald Trump tells Iranians 'help is on its way'
items.summary: Activists say around 2,500 people have been killed in protests against the country's ruling Islamic regime.

items.title: Global financial markets to face major test next week as central bankers support Powell
items.summary: Lisa Cook vs the US government will hit the courts next week. The case comes as Australia's Reserve Bank governor, Michele Bullock, signs a letter in support of US Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell, who is facing a criminal investigation in the United States.

items.title: The cricket bat maker taking his trade to the world
items.summary: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

items.title: Liberals divided over Labor's plan to outlaw inciting racial hatred
items.summary: After weeks criticising the Albanese government over the Bondi attack and issues around antisemitism, the Coalition is split over whether proposed solutions are at odds with its interests in preserving freedom of speech.

items.title: Public transport bypassed in Labor's Mount Barker re-election promises
items.summary: Labor today announced a $200 million investment in Mount Barker as part of its bid to win the seat of Kavel, but while some of those initiatives have been welcomed, there was a glaring omission in public transport solutions.

items.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Sydney Festival show asses.masses combines participatory theatre and the social fabric of playing video games together
items.summary: Theatre makers Patrick Blenkarn and Milton Lim have built a game to be played socially in an auditorium, with a single player leading a group of donkeys on a journey of discovery.

items.title: Ruffy community determined to rebuild after Longwood bushfire destroys Victorian town
items.summary: Residents in the central Victorian community of Ruffy say they are determined to rebuild after a bushfire destroyed most buildings in the small community.

items.title: Venus Williams exits Hobart International after straight-sets loss to Tatjana Maria
items.summary: After being awarded a wildcard at the age of 45, seven-time major singles champion Venus Williams falls in the opening round in Hobart.

items.title: Australian Open qualifying: Cruz Hewitt knocked out in first round, Storm Hunter returns with a win
items.summary: It is the second year in a row Hewitt has been knocked out in the first round of qualifying, but the match against a much higher-ranked opponent can only do good things for him.

items.title: Carnarvon growers enjoy massive mango season, bringing prices down for consumers
items.summary: A WA mango grower is pleasantly surprised to find a crop full of massive mangoes, as big as a bowling ball.

items.title: Koala captured on motion-sensor camera in rare sighting near Canberra
items.summary: A motion-sensor camera has captured the rare sight of a koala in the wild at a wildlife sanctuary in Googong near the ACT border.

items.title: l decluttered my wardrobe and said goodbye to 'fantasy me'
items.summary: I was tired of trying to live up to an idealised version of myself. So, I decided to do something I had learnt from Marie Kondo: sort my wardrobe into what brought me joy and what didn't.

items.title: Adelaide Writers' Week cancelled amid controversy over disinvitation of author Randa Abdel-Fattah
items.summary: The remaining members of the Adelaide Festival board will step down and this year's Writers' Week event has been cancelled, after days of furore regarding the decision to cancel a scheduled appearance by Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah.

items.title: Bridge fire near tourist town of Byron Bay highlights region's homelessness crisis
items.summary: A bridge used daily by thousands of drivers is shut in northern NSW, after a fire beneath it destroys the camps of two homeless men with "nowhere else to go".

items.title: Tasmanian pianist takes outdoor performances to striking mainland locations
items.summary: Kelvin Smith played a baby grand piano at some incredible sites across Tasmania before bringing his impromptu shows to amazing mainland locations.

items.title: Mount Alexander fire knocks out TV and radio across central Victoria
items.summary: A fast-moving fire has silenced free-to-air TV and radio across central Victoria — and it could take months to fix the site.

items.title: Rudd leaves US-Australia relationship in good shape ahead of Trump's China visit
items.summary: One month after Kevin Rudd leaves his post as Australia's ambassador to Washington, Donald Trump will make his first presidential visit to China in almost 10 years.

items.title: SA premier becomes emotional in press conference
items.summary: Peter Malinauskas becomes tearful during a media conference where he faces extensive questions about the crisis surrounding Adelaide Writers' Week and allegations of homophobia against Adelaide United made by former player Josh Cavallo.

items.title: Minnesota and the Twin Cities sue US federal government to stop immigration crackdown
items.summary: Minnesota and its two cities sue the Trump administration in a bid to stop an immigration crackdown that led to the fatal shooting of Renee Good last week.

items.title: Record number of black and grey-headed flying foxes die during east coast heatwave
items.summary: Wildlife rescuers warn extreme heat could kill more black and grey-headed flying foxes across NSW, with 700 dead animals already removed from two Illawarra camps.

items.title: Former A-League player Josh Cavallo alleges Adelaide United was homophobic
items.summary: Australia's first openly gay male professional footballer, Josh Cavallo, has alleged his former club was homophobic, something it denies.

items.title: Alyssa Healy's path to Australian cricket greatness was far from straightforward
items.summary: Alyssa Healy was thrust into headlines when she was just 16 for daring to break into a literal old boys' club, but has expertly handled the national spotlight with bat, ball and microphone in hand.

items.title: Global financial system hangs in balance as Federal Reserve independence challenged
items.summary: A criminal probe into the US Federal Reserve chair threatens to undermine the US dollar and the global monetary system. Local analysts warn the implications for Australia are profound.
